alert.note: Alert for Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 10:08PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Stonewall County through 1045 PM CDT... At 1007 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northeast of Jayton to 7 miles west of Hamlin to 5 miles southeast of Sylvester. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Aspermont, Old Glory and US-380 near the Haskell-Stonewall County line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
